The objective of OPIM 650 is to provide students with a set of tools that supports them in analyzing the operational performance of a company and to guide them in increasing the overall value of the firm by improving its operations. 
Students thought that while the course was “great,” “it has a lot more potential.” Specifically, students would have liked a bigger focus on “operational and financial due diligence” as well as “more concrete techniques to take away.” Many wished the class followed a prospective takeover analysis from start to finish. Instead, they thought that there was “too much free reign to class discussion” and worried that the lesson was sometimes “on the importance of due diligence, rather than how to.” This was the first time the course was offered and there was a general agreement that “this has the makings of a fantastic class.” 

Professor Lai was well liked for his “openness to class suggestions” and “enthusiasm for student learning.” He was described as an “intelligent and interactive lecturer.” Many wished that he would expand the course to a full semester. 

Students were divided on the merits of the assigned readings. While some found them “the most interesting part of the class,” others thought that “not all the cases were useful.”
